faqs.question: How can I apply for admission?
faqs.answer: You can apply for admission through the official SIT website by filling out the online application form available in the 'Admissions' section.

faqs.question: When does the admission process start?
faqs.answer: The admission process usually begins in April every year and continues until seats are filled.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for B.Tech courses?
faqs.answer: To apply for B.Tech, you must have passed 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, and have a valid WBJEE or JEE Main score.

faqs.question: Is there any entrance exam for admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, admission to B.Tech programs is based on WBJEE or JEE Main scores.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for B.Tech?
faqs.answer: The tuition fee for B.Tech is ₹1,05,000 per semester. Additional charges apply for hostel, exam, and registration.

faqs.question: Are there any management quota seats?
faqs.answer: Yes, a limited number of seats are available under the management quota. Please contact the admission office for more details.

faqs.question: What documents are needed during admission?
faqs.answer: You need to submit your 10th and 12th mark sheets, entrance exam scorecard, photo ID, passport size photos, and caste/income certificates if applicable.

faqs.question: Is there any scholarship for girls?
faqs.answer: Yes, SIT offers special scholarships for meritorious female candidates. Please check the scholarship section of our website for eligibility.

faqs.question: Can international students apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, international students can apply through the foreign admissions cell. Valid passport, visa, and academic transcripts are required.

faqs.question: What is the process for lateral entry in B.Tech?
faqs.answer: Diploma holders can apply for lateral entry directly into the 2nd year of B.Tech via JELET exam conducted by WBJEEB.

faqs.question: How can I register for counseling?
faqs.answer: You can register for counseling on the official WBJEEB or JEE Main portal, depending on your entrance exam.

faqs.question: Is there an offline application form available?
faqs.answer: No, the application process is entirely online through our website.

faqs.question: Can I visit the campus before applying?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can visit the campus between 10 AM to 4 PM on weekdays with prior appointment.

faqs.question: Can I apply for multiple courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can choose multiple course preferences during the application process.

faqs.question: Are diploma holders eligible for admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, diploma holders can apply for lateral entry into 2nd year of B.Tech.

faqs.question: What B.Tech branches are available?
faqs.answer: We offer B.Tech in Computer Science, Mechanical, Civil, Electrical, and Electronics & Communication.

faqs.question: Does SIT offer MCA or MBA?
faqs.answer: Yes, SIT offers both MCA and MBA programs with industry-relevant curriculum.

faqs.question: Do you offer any short-term or certification courses?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer certification programs in Python, AI/ML, IoT, and more.

faqs.question: Is there any integrated course like B.Tech + MBA?
faqs.answer: Currently, we do not offer integrated B.Tech + MBA programs.

faqs.question: What is the duration of B.Tech course?
faqs.answer: The B.Tech course duration is 4 years, divided into 8 semesters.

faqs.question: What is the minimum percentage required for admission?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 45% marks in 10+2 (PCM) is required for general category students.

faqs.question: Do you accept CUET scores?
faqs.answer: No, currently SIT does not consider CUET for engineering admissions.

faqs.question: Can students from other boards apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, students from any recognized board in India can apply.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for admission?
faqs.answer: There is no strict age limit, but applicants must have completed 10+2.

faqs.question: Do I need to attend any interview for admission?
faqs.answer: No interview is required for B.Tech admissions based on entrance scores.

faqs.question: Are the tuition fees same for all branches?
faqs.answer: Yes, tuition fees are uniform across all engineering branches.

faqs.question: Do you offer fee waivers?
faqs.answer: Fee waivers are available for economically weaker sections under certain criteria.

faqs.question: Is there a refund policy for fees?
faqs.answer: Yes, fee refunds are governed by AICTE refund rules depending on the withdrawal date.

faqs.question: Can I pay fees in installments?
faqs.answer: Yes, semester-wise installment payment is allowed.

faqs.question: What are the modes of payment accepted?
faqs.answer: We accept online payments, bank transfers, UPI, and demand drafts.

faqs.question: Are hostels compulsory?
faqs.answer: No, hostels are optional, but highly recommended for outstation students.

faqs.question: Is Wi-Fi available in hostels?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wi-Fi is available 24/7 in all hostel rooms and common areas.

faqs.question: Is there separate hostel for girls?
faqs.answer: Yes, we have separate secure hostels for girls and boys.

faqs.question: Is outside food allowed in hostel?
faqs.answer: Outside food is generally discouraged; mess food is hygienic and nutritious.

faqs.question: Can parents stay on campus during admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, limited guest accommodation is available for parents during admission.

faqs.question: What is the average placement package?
faqs.answer: The average package ranges between ₹4.5 to ₹6 LPA depending on the branch.

faqs.question: Which companies visit the campus?
faqs.answer: Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Capgemini, Cognizant, and more.

faqs.question: Are internships mandatory?
faqs.answer: Yes, internships are a part of the curriculum in later semesters.

faqs.question: Is there training provided for placements?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide pre-placement training including aptitude, soft skills, and coding.

faqs.question: Do you have placement for non-CS branches?
faqs.answer: Yes, all branches get placement opportunities with relevant companies.

faqs.question: Is there an on-campus medical facility?
faqs.answer: Yes, a first-aid medical center with doctor-on-call service is available.

faqs.question: Do you have a gym on campus?
faqs.answer: Yes, a fully equipped gym is available for students.

faqs.question: Is there a library in the college?
faqs.answer: Yes, SIT has a digital and physical library with thousands of academic resources.

faqs.question: Are there ATM facilities on campus?
faqs.answer: Yes, ATMs of major banks are located within the campus.

faqs.question: Is the campus ragging-free?
faqs.answer: Yes, SIT has a strict anti-ragging policy enforced by the disciplinary committee.

faqs.question: Where is SIT located?
faqs.answer: Siliguri Institute of Technology is located at Hill Cart Road, Salbari, Sukna, Siliguri.

faqs.question: What are the college timings?
faqs.answer: Classes usually run from 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM, Monday to Friday.

faqs.question: How can I contact the admission office?
faqs.answer: You can call +91-XXXXXXXXXX or email admissions@sittechno.org.

faqs.question: Is there any dress code or uniform?
faqs.answer: There is no strict dress code, but students are expected to dress decently.

faqs.question: Do you provide transport facility?
faqs.answer: Yes, college buses are available from major points in Siliguri.

faqs.question: Where is the campus located?
faqs.answer: Siliguri Institute of Technology is located at Hill Cart Road, Salbari, Sukna, Siliguri, West Bengal - 734009.

faqs.question: Are there any scholarship programs available?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer merit-based and need-based scholarships. You can apply through the scholarship portal on our website.

faqs.question: Where can I find the academic calendar?
faqs.answer: The academic calendar is available on the college website under the 'Academics' section.

faqs.question: How can I access my class schedule?
faqs.answer: Login to the student portal and go to the 'Time Table' section.

faqs.question: When are the internal exams conducted?
faqs.answer: Midterm exams are usually held in March and final exams in June and December, depending on the semester.

faqs.question: How do I apply for a revaluation of my answer sheets?
faqs.answer: You can apply through the exam section of the student portal within 7 days of the result declaration.

faqs.question: What is the attendance policy?
faqs.answer: Students must maintain at least 75% attendance to be eligible for semester exams.

faqs.question: How do I use the college library?
faqs.answer: Use your student ID to access the library. You can borrow up to 3 books for 14 days.

faqs.question: Are hostels available for students?
faqs.answer: Yes, separate hostels are available for boys and girls with mess and Wi-Fi facilities.

faqs.question: Is there a placement cell in the college?
faqs.answer: Yes, our dedicated placement cell conducts training and placement drives with top companies.

faqs.question: How can I contact my faculty?
faqs.answer: Faculty contact details are listed on the department page of the college website or available through the student portal.

faqs.question: Can I get a bonafide certificate online?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can apply for a bonafide certificate through the student portal under the ‘Certificates’ section.

faqs.question: What is the process to get a transfer certificate?
faqs.answer: Submit a written application to the academic office. After clearance from all departments, the TC will be issued.

faqs.question: How do I register for campus events or fests?
faqs.answer: Registrations are usually open on the college event portal or through department notices.

faqs.question: What are the rules for using college transport?
faqs.answer: Students must carry their ID cards and follow the bus schedule. Monthly passes can be purchased from the transport office.

faqs.question: How can I access online learning resources?
faqs.answer: Login to the student portal and navigate to the 'E-Learning' section for access to course materials and lectures.

faqs.question: Are there any research opportunities for undergraduates?
faqs.answer: Yes, students can participate in faculty-led research projects during their final year.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for leave?
faqs.answer: Submit a leave application to your class coordinator with valid reasons at least 2 days in advance.

faqs.question: How do I get my transcripts?
faqs.answer: Request transcripts through the academic office by filling out a form and paying the required fee.

faqs.question: Are there any language courses offered?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer courses in French, German, and Spanish as electives in the second year.

faqs.question: What are the rules for using college labs?
faqs.answer: Students must follow safety protocols, wear lab coats, and report any damages immediately.

faqs.question: How can I participate in inter-college competitions?
faqs.answer: Keep an eye on announcements from the student affairs office or your department for upcoming events.

faqs.question: What is the process for obtaining a migration certificate?
faqs.answer: Apply through the academic office with a written request and necessary documents; processing takes 10 days.

faqs.question: Are there any entrepreneurship programs available?
faqs.answer: Yes, we have an incubation center that supports student startups with mentorship and funding opportunities.
